statements.statement: How current is the data used in making this recommendation?
How clean/accurate is the data used in making this recommendation?
How much data was used to train this system?
Can I see the data for myself?
What is the signal:noise ratio?
How is this data weighted or what does the system prioritize?
What does the system depend on in order to work properly, and do we know if those dependencies are functioning properly?
Is my data uniquely different from the data on which the system has been trained?
What is the level of uncertainty in this recommendation?
How often is the system checked for model accuracy?
What safeguards are there to protect users from incorrect system outputs?
How many other options are there?
What are the pros/cons associated with this option?
Why is this recommendation the best option?
What indicators were considered in this recommendation, and how are they weighted?
What is the history of performance of this system?
Under what circumstances has this system been wrong in the past?
Precisely what information about me does the system know, and how is that information considered in this recommendation?

Was this recommendation made specifically for ME (based on my profile/interests), or was it made based on something else (based on some other model, such as corporate profit, or my friend’s interests, etc.)?
Does the system know and understand my goals?
What does the system THINK I want to achieve? (How does the system represent my priorities and goals?)
Can I influence the system by providing feedback? Will it listen and consider my input?
What is the system’s level of confidence in this recommendation?
How is ‘system confidence’ measured?
What is the system’s level of “acceptable risk?”
What does the system think is MY level of “acceptable risk?”
How many other people have received this recommendation from this system?
How many other people have accepted or rejected this recommendation from this system? (What is the ratio of approve:disapprove?)
